encyclopedia.content: 即笔记本电脑。根据材料和大小有多种不同数量级的重量。手提电脑和笔记本电脑两个词语常常不区分使用。下面的内容即是一段简单的对笔记本发展历史进行介绍的英语小论文。

entry.tran: 便携式电脑；膝上（或手提）电脑
entry.def: A laptop or a laptop computer is a small portable computer.

example.ex: She used to work at her laptop until four in the morning.
example.tran: 她从前经常用手提电脑一直工作到凌晨4点。

example.ex: ...a laptop computer he called Magic Slate.
example.tran: 一台被他称作“魔幻书写板”的便携式电脑

means.word_mean: 1. a portable computer small enough to use in your lap

Sentence.sentence: So a third of the people in my program were using the iPad in class to take notes, the other third were using laptops and the last third were using paper and pencil.
She'd wake up early, turn on her laptop and chat on Internet dating sites and instant-messaging programs – leaving her bed for only brief intervals.
Robert Summers, who has taught at Cornell Law School for about 40 years, announced this week in a detailed, footnoted memorandum - that he would ban laptop computers from his class on contract law.
Professor Robert Summers at Cornell Law School banned laptop computers from his thinks qualified lawyers need to possess a broad array of complex reasoning abilities
Students already have laptops and cell phones, of course, but the newest devices can take class distractions to a new level.

sentences.en: A laptop would be really useful for when I’m working on the train.
sentences.cn: 我在火车上工作时, 便携式电脑真的很有用。
